q: What powder-coating finishes are available for flood barriers?
a: Standard RAL 9003 white, 7035 light gray, 7021 charcoal. Custom colors on request. UV-stable polyester resists chalking for > 15 years coastal exposure.

q: Does powder coating affect barrier performance?
a: No—coating thickness < 80 µm adds minimal tolerance and actually protects from galvanic corrosion. Always bake below 200 °C to preserve gasket bond.
Yes, after light media blast and solvent wipe. Use identical polyester resin to maintain gloss uniformity. Refer to flood-panel repair for prep steps.

q: Are matte or gloss finishes better for coastal climates?
a: Matte hides salt deposits and micro-scratches; gloss reflects heat. Choice is aesthetic—both carry identical corrosion ratings.
